questions.question_text: Which two statements apply to features of aggregate bandwidth allocation in Prisma Access for remote networks? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
It's BC, going thurther 100% usage of BP is no longer possible. It was in the past when BP was assigned per RN site but not anymore with the BP assigned to a compute region.

Selected Answer: BC
B and C

Selected Answer: BC
I go for BC and agree with yet_another_user and aditya_eureka
B and D: Prisma access divides bandwidth between branches belonging to a compute location and later adjust to a more efficient bandwidth usage

Selected Answer: BC
B and C

Selected Answer: BC

choices.B: Administrator must assign a minimum of 50 MB to any compute location that will support remote networks.
choices.A: Administrator can allocate up to 120% of the total bandwidth purchased for aggregate locations to support traffic peaks.

questions.question_text: In which step of the Five-Step Methodology for implementing the Zero Trust model are the services most valuable to the company defined?

choices.D: The increased complexity of the model over previous products reduces IT team staffing costs.
choices.B: The compact size of the components involved reduces overhead costs, as less physical space is needed.
choices.C: The content inspection integration allows third-party assessment, which reduces the cost of contract services.
choices.A: The single platform reduces costs compared to buying and managing multiple point products.

questions.question_text: How does the secure access service edge (SASE) security model provide cost savings to organizations?

discussion.content:
I believe the correct answer is A according to SASE Study Guide:
Cost savings: Instead of buying and managing multiple point products, utilizing a single platform
will dramatically reduce your costs and IT resources.

Selected Answer: A
For sure A.
